summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from December 6-7, 2018, between individuals coordinating a meeting to discuss the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) after lawmakers called for a DOJ investigation. It references a news article about political pressure regarding Epstein's plea deal.

events.title: Lawmakers call for DOJ investigation into Epstein NPA
events.description: Various lawmakers publicly called on the Department of Justice to explain the Non-Prosecution Agreement given to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Coordination of meeting about Epstein NPA
events.description: Individuals exchanged emails to schedule a meeting (proposed for 11:00 AM) to discuss the Epstein case and the political pressure surrounding the NPA.

keyFacts: In December 2018, lawmakers were publicly demanding the DOJ explain Jeffrey Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
A news article from NBC News detailing the lawmakers' demands was circulated among the email correspondents.
The correspondence shows coordination for a meeting (proposed at 11:00 AM) to discuss the Epstein NPA in response to the political pressure.
The email addresses suggest involvement from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The document reflects internal communication about managing public and political scrutiny of the Epstein plea deal years after it was finalized.
